title: Authors and Citation
text: Mike Dietze. Author. David LeBauer. Author, maintainer. Xiaohui Feng. Author. Dan Wang. Author. Carl Davidson. Author. Rob Kooper. Author. Shawn Serbin. Author. Ankur Desai. Author. James Simkins. Author. Chris Black. Author. Istem Fer. Author. Hamze Dookohaki. Author. Alexey Shiklomanov. Author. Elizabeth Cowdery. Author. Ann Raiho. Author. Tess McCabe. Author. Tony Gardella. Author. University Illinois, NCSA. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: LeBauer, D.S., D. Wang, K. Richter, C. Davidson, Mike C. Dietze. 2012. Feedbacks measurements models facilitated scientific workflows: Predictive Ecosystem Analyzer. Ecological Monographs.
code: @Article{,   author = {David S. LeBauer and Dan Wang and Katherine T. Richter and Carl C. Davidson and Michael C. Dietze},   title = {Feedbacks between measurements and models facilitated by scientific workflows: the Predictive Ecosystem Analyzer},   journal = {Ecological Monographs},   year = {2012},   url = {pecanproject.org}, }

what: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis
title: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis
text: PEcAn functions used ecological forecasts reanalysis

title: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis
text: can install development version PEcAn.r-universe like : can install directly GitHub remotes package like :
code: # Enable repository from pecanproject options(repos = c(   pecanproject = 'https://pecanproject.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org')) # Download and install PEcAn.all in R install.packages('PEcAn.all') library(remotes) install_github('pecanproject/pecan',  subdir = "base/all")

title: PEcAn Functions Used for Ecological Forecasts and Reanalysis
text: basic example shows solve common problem:

what: Dates, tags, and versions of all PEcAn releases — pecan_releases
title: Dates, tags, and versions of all PEcAn releases — pecan_releases
Dates, tags, and versions of all PEcAn releases — pecan_releases
Dates, tags, and versions of all PEcAn releases — pecan_releases
text: Data frame 3 columns tag name used mark release date date released version numeric version assigned release

title: Dates, tags, and versions of all PEcAn releases — pecan_releases
text: Extracted Git tags PEcAn development repository

title: Report installed PEcAn version — pecan_version
text: Reports currently installed loaded version(s) PEcAn package, well versions expected specified release(s) PEcAn system.

title: Report installed PEcAn version — pecan_version
text: version PEcAn release number use expected package versions exact Show tags exactly match version, tags substring?

title: Report installed PEcAn version — pecan_version
text: data frame columns package name, expected version(s), installed version, Git hash (known). sessioninfo package installed, additional column reports package installed : local, github, CRAN, etc.

title: Report installed PEcAn version — pecan_version
text: exact = FALSE (default), pecan_version show releases whose names contain version substring. mostly e.g. "1.4.2" finds release tag "v1.4.2", since matches returned can also handy seeing patches sharing minor version number (see examples). one version package installed, output pecan_version() contain multiple rows package. can occur installed different versions different locations .libPaths(), loaded new version current session loading source directory without installing R library. see multiple rows unexpectedly, try find.package(<pkgname>, verbose = TRUE) see version found.

title: Report installed PEcAn version — pecan_version
code: pecan_version() #>  package               v1.9.0 installed source               #>  PEcAn.BASGRA          1.8.1  1.8.1     local (/pecan/mod... #>  PEcAn.BIOCRO          1.7.4  1.7.5     local (/pecan/mod... #>  PEcAn.CABLE           1.7.4  NA        NA                   #>  PEcAn.CLM45           1.7.4  1.7.4     local (/pecan/mod... #>  PEcAn.DALEC           1.7.4  1.7.5     local what: Versions of all PEcAn packages in each release of PEcAn — pecan_version_history
title: Versions of all PEcAn packages in each release of PEcAn — pecan_version_history
Versions of all PEcAn packages in each release of PEcAn — pecan_version_history
Versions of all PEcAn packages in each release of PEcAn — pecan_version_history
text: Data frame least 33 columns (plus one every release!) package Package name, character v1.0, ..., v1.7.2, .... Release numbers, Git tag column name numeric package versions row contents. NA means package exist version PEcAn.

title: Versions of all PEcAn packages in each release of PEcAn — pecan_version_history
text: Extracted Git history PEcAn development repository

title: PEcAn.all 1.9.0
text: PEcAn.now distributed BSD three-clause license instead NCSA Open Source license.

title: PEcAn.all 1.9.0
text: pecan_version() now reports Git revision (known) package, prints results compactly easier reading.

title: PEcAn.all 1.8.0
text: New function pecan_version() reports versions currently installed PEcAn packages, along versions expected given release PEcAn. New datasets pecan_version_history pecan_releases, primarily intended use pecan_version() available perusal .

title: PEcAn.all 1.7.1
text: changes 1.7.1 earlier recorded single file PEcAn packages; please see https://github.com/PecanProject/pecan/blob/v1.7.1/CHANGELOG.md details.
